title: Grammar of Graphics for Linear Model Diagnostic Plots
text: gglm two main types functions. First, gglm() function used quickly creating four main diagnostic plots, behaves similarly plot() works lm type object. Second, stat_*() functions used produce diagnostic plots creating ggplot2 layers. layers allow plotting particular model diagnostic plots within ggplot2 framework.

what: Example 1: Quickly creating the four diagnostic plots with gglm()
title: Grammar of Graphics for Linear Model Diagnostic Plots
text: Consider simple linear model used predict miles per gallon weight. can fit model lm(), diagnose easily using gglm().  Now, one may interested complicated model, mixed model varying intercept cyl, fit lme4 package. Luckily, gglm accommodates variety models modeling packages, diagnostic plots mixed model can created way simple linear model.
code: library(gglm) # Load gglm  model <- lm(mpg ~ wt, data = mtcars) # Fit the simple linear model  gglm(model) # Plot the four main diagnostic plots library(lme4) # Load lme4 to fit the mixed model  mixed_model <- lmer(mpg ~ wt + (1 | cyl), data = mtcars) # Fit the mixed model  gglm(mixed_model) # Plot the four main diagnostic plots.
